# Education Coordinator for Stream to Sea Program and Community Outreach Activities

## Project Description
Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking a qualified education coordinator to provide delivery and coordination services for the Stream to Sea program and related community outreach activities in the Lower Fraser River area of British Columbia.

## Services Required

* Coordination of educational experiences for students and teachers, including setup and operation of classroom incubators, egg delivery, and teacher in-service training.
* Organizing and participating in specialized educational activities, such as fish dissections, aquatic ecosystems, and habitat requirements for salmon.
* Developing and delivering educational programs for teachers and students, including workshops and presentations on environmental sustainability and stream-to-sea migration.
* Collaborating with community groups, attending community events, and supporting volunteer hatcheries and community groups in the region.
* Supporting the Storm Drain Marking Program, including training, equipment, and logistical support to groups participating in the program.

## Scope of Work
The scope of work will include:

* Developing a work plan for the region, aligned with the geographic area and Stream to Sea program requirements.
* Working with Community Advisors to coordinate and deliver services in the Lower Fraser River area.
* Providing support and maintenance for the DFO classroom incubation program, including organizing teacher in-service workshops, providing technical support, and coordinating equipment and supplies.
* Delivering educational opportunities, support, and assistance for teachers with tanks and assisting with the development and delivery of a spring fry release program.
* Encouraging participation from teachers and ensuring recognition for years of service.

## Eligibility Criteria
The tender is open to all qualified contractors who possess the necessary experience, skills, and qualifications to provide the required services.
